intro: Adriana gaudichaudii var. subglabra, commonly known as the smooth-leaved Adriana, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant features smooth, glabrous leaves that contrast with the hairy leaves of its typical counterpart, adding to its botanical interest. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
